definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to walk (side part of split character)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
Dalian subprovincial city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China
to link/to join/to attach/connection/a link (on web page)
to be related/to entail/to involve/joint (liability etc)
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
electrical lead/connecting line/(Tw) to connect (to a network, device etc)/to go online/connection/(congressional) caucus
Dalian subprovincial city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China

sentences.english: They cant change a light bulb or without making a sketch.
sentences.chinese: 他们连灯泡都不会换，或者至少要先画个草图。

sentences.english: The tolls, which include a government passage tax, varied from $4 to $30 per vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 隧道收费连政府通过税，每程由4元至30元不等。

sentences.english: However, even resist to all tin not do it, again He Tan resists.
sentences.chinese: 然而，连抗拒都做不到，又何谈反抗。
连父亲都深深地被打动。

sentences.english: Firecrackers exploded, flags flew high, and cars honked wildly.
sentences.chinese: 炮声阵阵，旗帜飞扬，就连汽车的喇叭都摁得朝天响。

sentences.english: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.
sentences.chinese: 然而你们连一根头发，也必不损坏。

sentences.english: Hello, I'm here to see Mr. Carlene.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我是来见卡连先生的。

sentences.english: Or maybe I don't even remember that I was alive.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可能连活着都不记得。

sentences.english: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge--to the great amazement of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣仍不回答，连一句话也不说，以致巡抚甚觉希奇。

sentences.english: The soldiers of Baker Company , 31st Infantry, would be in reserve.
sentences.chinese: 陆军31步兵团的B连被留作为预备队。

sentences.english: The two switch regions move the most.
sentences.chinese: 连个转变区移动地最多。

sentences.english: Your price is too high to even interest buyers in counter-offer.
sentences.chinese: 你的价格太高，买方连还盘都没有兴趣。

sentences.english: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣仍不回答，连一句话也不说，以致巡抚甚觉希奇。

sentences.english: John couldn't even pick up the box, much less carry it upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 约翰连这箱子提都提不起来，更别说把它搬上楼了。

sentences.english: On my first day of school, I didn't speak a word of English.
sentences.chinese: 当我第一天上学时，我连一个英文单词都说不出口。

sentences.english: Pangu open days soon, then, heaven and the earth is almost connected.
sentences.chinese: 盘古开天不久，那时，天和地差不多连着。

definition: all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
variant of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
